name: ENERGY STAR Com. ASHP (FS) CC

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical measure penetration is captured in baseline

energy_efficiency_source.notes: ENERGY STAR V. 4.0 went into effect in January 2023 as reflected under 2023 column.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

installed_cost_source.notes: ENERGY STAR V. 4.0 installed cost in 2023 divided by typical capacity (90 kBtu/h cooling).

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.title: CBECS 2018 - Table E1 -  Major fuels consumption by end use, 2018
market_scaling_fractions_source.fraction_derivation: Heating fraction reflects portion of heating consumption in building where cooling is served by a chiller or district chilled water (703 TBtus space heating w/ chiller/district cooling out of 2167 TBtus space heating across all buildings), under the assumption that this service is not replacable by the targeted heat pump; cooling fraction excludes cooling in buildings that use electric source of primary heating (221 TBtus cooling in buildings with electric primary heating / 589 TBtus cooling in all buildings).

_description: Typical size light commercial rooftop HP unit that meets the ENERGY STAR performance standard, cold-climate
